Reviews.Content: Great location, great rates. We checked in the waikiki Joy for a weeks stay. I can't complain about the price and the location was awesome. It is n very short walking distance to everything you want to see in Waikiki. The rooms were clean and everything was as expected and looked like the pictures you see on the hotel website. Continental breakfast was just enough as a previous writer said, but watch out for the lady who keeps it stocked, she will not acknowledge or move out of the way for you. In my opionion, she should not attend to the table every two minutes. All in all, the experience was good, the tub was great to soak in after hitting the beach and going shopping. I would stay there again for the price and location.
Reviews.Author: Greenwoodrabbit

Reviews.Content: It really was a Joy We live in Honolulu and stayed at the Waikiki Joy for a weekend and loved it. There's a certain charm about the property that you can't find at most big hotel chains. Plus, you can't beat the location--it's only a block away from all the clubs and shopping and restaurants we wanted to visit. We booked an executive 1bdrm suite and I'd highly recommend doing the same. It was huge, nicely decorated and very comfortable with a kitchen. I also thought it was a nice touch that we received 2 free drink coupons for their on-site restaurant. It was quiet, pleasant, and the staff was friendly and helpful. We had a great time and will definitely be back for a weekend trip again.
Reviews.Author: happynhawaii

Reviews.Content: no joy at the joy We booked via our travelagent and reqested a twin room because of health problems. On 3 occasions before travelling I asked travel agent to check that it was a twin room not a double room we were to get we were assured even after our agent phoning United Vacations that we would be given a twin roomWhen we arrived after a 30hour journey we did not even get a foot in the hotel grounds when a porter came out and told us we were not being allowed in we had to go to another hotel. On querying as to why this was happening we were told we were being upgraded because we were 'so nice people'. This was said I hasten to add in a most facetious manner. I asked where we were to go and again why and was again told that we were being upgraded because we were so nice people. We were told to get complimentary drinks of our choice whilst they arranged transfers and would look after our luggage. Vouchers given were for non alcoholic drinks or coffee. Halfway through our drinks we were called - our transport was there - when we got to the front door there was no sign of our luggage or our transport. We were quite worried and upset as medication for the whole trip as well as our belongings to our tired minds were no where to be seen and we wondered if we had actually walked into a nightmare instead of paradise. Eventually a staff member came and said that they'd phoned the other hotel and our luggage was there. They then provided a limo to take us to this still unknown upgraded hotel - after travelling 30 hours a limo is not exactly the easiest mode of transport to get in and out of. When we arrived at the other hotel we found the rooms to be small double and stinking of urine and no lanais. We spoke to the reception who offered to show us a twin room but it was not the sort of hotel which attracted us. We were taken back to the 'Joy' after another wait for a taxi. Where they then said that we would be given rooms there. Apprehensively we went to see these rooms and although much better the bed in our room was still not twin. Our friends were okay with theirs but our room was still not what we requested via our agent. We accepted the room on the understanding that the room be sorted out the next day. After a lengthy discussion with the manager the next day in which he first off said no bedroom type are guaranteed only a request, then denied he had any twin roomsin the hotel I challenged this by sayig they were advertised on the net, then he suggested if we paid extra there would be a twin room, when we said we would not pay any more than we already had and said that he had overbooked his hotel and why didn't he upgrade us for free as he the night before had been willing to upgrade us in another hotel, then he stated he hadn't oversold his rooms - (to which we have had confirmation in a letter from United Vacations that the rooms were oversold.) and that the other hotel was of a same star rating not an upgrade as we'd been told the night before. I was suffering stress and the beginnings of a hypo when I eventually spoke to a rep via phone from United Vacations and we were offered to be put up in yet another hotel at the other side of the town from our friends.The hotel did eventually put a roll away bed in the room but it ended up sagging in the middle after 10 nights and gave my partner a sore back. Afterwards during our stay we then found if we approached reception we were not welcome this was also felt by our friends. We were being treated like lepers. Other British couples we spoke to had also suffered similar experiences of being told there was no rooms available and also were taken to this and another hotel but also found them to be awful. Signage round the pool area was also only in English and other nationalities were freely jumping in and out of the pool without showering after visiting the loos as well as tossing dirty surf boards in to clean them. We certainly wouldn't recommend staying at the Joy not unless you were prepared to do a long jaunt after your already long flights.
Reviews.Author: scotwanderer

Reviews.Content: A really good choice       Towards Reception area at the Joy
Reviews.Author: moruya2

Reviews.Content: In the thick of it.. Before I booked the Suite in the Hibiscus Tower I mentioned to staff there that I did not wish to be within earshot of the Karaoke Bar (situated at the base of the Hibiscus Tower) which is open untill 05:00ish.Unfortunately the first Suite they put us in I could hear the music quite clearly. A move to the other tower would have meant downgrading, however they did move us to the 6th floor and that was fine.Also before we arrived I struck a deal with the hotel that I could pay a 'Season Ticket' for the car park as were planning on staying for 21 nights and did not relish shelling out $210 in valet fees. (Although that would have been cheap in Waikiki ). The hotel did agree to this ( $100 for 21 nights) but upon arrival no one knew anything about this. However they did take my word for it and honoured the deal ( I had left the crucial email back in England ). They gave me validation permit to hang at the back of the rear view mirror.On one occasion I forgot to place the permit on the mirror and got a ticket from the Parking Company. However, the staff at the Joy, particularly Mike pulled out all the stops  sorted out my stupid mistake.Top marks to the staff at the Joy.Breakfast was good. Mostely fresh fruit, toast  coffee. What else do you want?? Just wish that staff would ask the persistant smokers around the pool area to clear off on to the sidewalk and commit slow suicide away from the pool area where other non smoking, paying guests would rather like to breath fresh air and not carcinagenic second hand smokers air!! Blahh!!!Overall great hotel, fab location, good staff - shame about the pathetic smokers.Would absolutelty go back there again.JSL Northamptonshire England UK
Reviews.Author: scott5

Reviews.Content: Loved the JoyResort We loved the location of the Hotel and found the staff to be very helpful. We needed a Doctor the first night there and they were able to recommend one that was only a block from the Hotel....We found the breakfast provided by the hotel to be all we needed....The room was clean and ready when we arrived......Loved the room and especially the Bathroom.....It was all we needed in a room.............
Reviews.Author: ohio1Ohio4

Reviews.Content: Friendly Staff, Clean room We enjoyed our 2 night stay at this hotel.I'm giving it above average because the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the room was surprisingly clean. There were plenty of soft, big towels for us. Toto water-saver toilet that looked brand new.Staff at the desk was friendly and helpful assisting us with phone calls, maps, catching shuttles, and suggestions. From the bar we had several different, very yummy, drinks.Breakfast was adequate food with very good service. One could hardly take a slice of bread for toast without it being replaced immediately. Plenty of fresh fruit while we were there.It was noisy with garbage haulers at all hours of the day. We slept with the air conditioning on to mask it. Our air conditioner was placed directly over the bed, so with each up and down sweep, we had air rushing across us. Not ideal, but we got used to it. Close to all shopping, high end and low end. Short walk to the beach. Loved sitting in the sunshine on the patio.Reasonable rates, we would recommend it.
Reviews.Author: JuliaSovietnova

Reviews.Content: Good location, reasonable price My husband and I stayed at the Waikiki Joy for 3 nights on our recent stay in Oahu. When I booked the room in August 2007 Trip Advisor had mainly good reviews, but as our departure date drew closer there were more negative and mixed reviews and I began to panic a bit that we'd made a poor choice. However, it was too late to book another room at a reasonable price, so we decided to hope for the best.We arrived at 5 pm and got checked in. I would describe the check-in process as transactional . . . . everything got done, but the clerk wasn't overly friendly. I had booked a room with a queen/king bed and specificially requested a room not near the elevator. When we got to the room, it was, yes, you guessed it, immediately next to the elevator and had two double beds. I immediately went back downstairs to the front desk where the clerk was surprised that I didn't like the room as it was an upgrade to a larger corner unit. When I explained to him that a bigger room didn't help us when we'd have to sleep in separate beds, he gave us another room. This one was also right next to the elevator (not sure why they ask for comments when you book when they clearly don't pay any attention to them), but we decided to take it. Fortunately, the elevators were quiet enough that they didn't bother us.Our room was fine for a few days stay, including a small refrigerator, coffee maker, and stereo system. We had a balcony with a partial view of the ocean, which was an unexpected bonus. It was a nice place to go out in the morning and enjoy a quick cup of coffee. The bathroom had a large tub with bubble jets which we made use of, although the tub and its surround was in need of updating-it looked like it was original to the hotel, while much of the rest of the room had been updated. The woman who did the cleaning always greeted us in the hall and kept our room spotless and supplied with everything we needed.The hotel also had a lovely first floor open air dining area where we had breakfast each morning, as well as a cute little koi pond. The continental breakfast was a quick way to get a bite to eat prior to starting our daily adventures and consisted of fresh fruit, bagels, rolls, juice and coffee. Again, the staff got the job done, but were pretty indifferent to the guests.The Waikiki Joy has a good central location, about 3 blocks off of Waikiki Beach and one block from Kuhio Avenue, where you can pick up the bus going to Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, Haunama Bay, etc. It is also close to lots of stores and eating establishments. We paid $139 per night and I was satisfied with our stay for the price with the exception of the last night, when we were awakened at 1 am by the most terrible racket that proceeded to continue for 3 hours. I was told by the clerk at the front desk the next morning, who was very apologetic, that the building across the street was beginning construction, had been unloading scaffolding and that the work was expected to continue for 4 months. She had received a number of guest complaints, had called the police to get them to stop and was going to have building management talk with the owners regarding their future plans and the noise level. We were just very happy at that point to be heading off to Maui where we could get caught up on our sleep!In sum, we would stay at the Waikiki Joy again for the price and location. If you are looking for a luxury hotel or oceanfront location, it's probably not the right hotel for you, but if you are looking for a clean, serviceable hotel in a central location, it would fit the bill.
Reviews.Author: threecatmomma

Reviews.Content: Ok for a few nights We stayed here for 4 nights on our way home of the mainland. Our room was not ready when we arrived as check in is not until 3pm. We went and had lunch at The Cheescake Factory (a must place to eat) and when we came back our room was ready and we have been upgraded to one of the second largest suites in the hotel. It contained 2 double beds, a small lounge area with tv  vide and kitchenette with micro, toaster, rice cooker and hot plates, full size fridge. Bathroom had spa and a bottom washer on the toilet!! Room was larger enough for a family of 4 with 2 teenage daughters with loads of shopping. Room had a large balcony but unfortunately this only overlooked the street. The hotel has a karioke bar downstairs and that can be noisey later at night early morning as can the cars and garbage trucks that come by early morning. Front desk staff were great, recommended Paradise Cove Luau which is excellent, not cheap but well worth the trip. Rooms were cleaned with fresh towels each day and beach towels were available also. Pool is not large at all but enough to cool down in. The out look of the pool is not great, another building next door. Location is good, short walk to beach and 1 minute walk to main shopping strip. Breakfast is good and plenty to eat.
Reviews.Author: Melbourneites

Reviews.Content: Mixed review The continental breakfast was quite good and generous.The hotel cleaners regularly changed the towels and cleaned the room.The majority of the staff were fair.However, the noise during the early hours of the morning was disturbing as it lasted until 5am sometimes. The noise was due to young hooligans screaming and shouting. Also, the trucks/buses often made noise starting in the early morning from the DFS.Unfortunately, on the last morning we were checking out we were told that our room had to be 'checked to see if anything had been stolen'. My husband and I were surprised to be informed about this as we had not heard of other hotels doing this type of check before. When I asked to see the hotel procedures in writing I was abruptly and rudely told to 'speak to the Manager' (which was impossible at that time, because we had to catch a plane). The impolite conduct left us feeling embarrassed and upset. We were also surprised to be charged over $1 per local phone call to such local places as a restaurant booking. Beware of the pitfalls.
Reviews.Author: Globaltrotter9

Reviews.Content: Just Magic This was an excellent choice for our six night stay, we had concerns, as probably many of you reading this no doubt will which is why your checking these reviews. We had a twin double room on the ninth floor next to the lift, which I dont actually remember disturbing us in any way, this room came with a partial ocean view which considering your two blocks from the beach we thought was brilliant, if you want oceanfront this might not be for you, please do some research on location, so you wont be dissappointed if thats your major desire. Oh and enjoy the extra cost for that privilage.The staff were great and helped when ever required with bookings, post etc. Its location is great for most if not all activities and tours espcially the shopping. Our room was clean  comfortable, loved the jacuzzi. The continental breakfast was simple but adequate and there are plenty of restaurants near by who also do a great breakfast ie Mooses :-). We really enjoyed our stay and thought Waikiki Joy offered excellent value for money.
Reviews.Author: AustralianDad

Reviews.Content: Waikiki wha? Boy, were we built up for this hotel! The location was horrible...very hard to find, on a one way street, and in the middle of town...when they mean city view, they mean just that. Steps away from the beach sounds great...if you want to hike several blocks carrying snorkelling gear, boogie boards and a cooler. It's a catch-22 because there is little parking (and it isn't free) in Honolulu. If you're trip centers around ocean/beach oriented activities, stay on one of the beach resorts...it doesn't cost much more. Valet parking is the only option at $10 @ day. Didn't like this much. While we loaded/unloaded the attendants got impatient, then they wanted a tip. The front desk gets mixed reviews. 1 out of 3 were helpful and nice. At checkout, we were informed we were being charged $2.60 everytime my 9 year old opened AND shut the safe in our room. Also, beware of the BREAKFAST NAZI. Don't show up before 7am and don't take a bagel to your room. SKIP the POOL! SKIP the Jacuzzi (ie garden bathtub)Pool was the size of a hottub located in the main lobby. Like the jacuzzi in the rooms, you didn't want to get in it!The room was comfortable...it looked clean until you saw ants in the kitchenette. And realized the carpeting didn't lay flat on the floor anywhere. We were awakened by police sirens...9 cop cars under our window at 2am...thought the bum that puked on himself the previous night had died...just a bar fight though, with 3 handcuffed men lying face down in the street. Basically, the price you pay originally won't be it...other hotels charge a reasonable daily fee for all inclusive ammenities...The only thing we weren't charged for was breathing...holding breath until I receive my next statement!
Reviews.Author: cheapymagee

Reviews.Content: Only when you really want to party, Or money is tight.       Our lovely view
Reviews.Author: av8trswife

Reviews.Content: Good Time We arrived on 27th July 2007 from Queensland Australia. We stayed 11 nights and were very happy with our accommodation. We were on the 4th Floor overlooking Lewers Street. The room was very clean, towels changed every day and bed linen every second day. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to everything we needed. Once the door was closed to lanai you could not hear street noise. The staff were friendly and helpful. We will certainly return to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: madbru

Reviews.Content: Good Kama`aina Choice We were visiting Oahu from a neighbor island and needed a place to stay for one night. The Waikiki Joy was a good choice. Resortquest offers very reasonable kama`aina rates (for Hawaii residents) on all of their properties. The location is a few blocks from the beach (mauka of Kalakaua on Lewers St.) but it's easily walkable. There is a Starbucks kiosk directly across the street. Parking was valet only at $10 a day, and valet service was always prompt. The hotel is on the small side, with a pleasant garden feeling in the white-marble lobby. There is a small pool next to the breakfast area. Beyond the lobby, you can tell that the place hasn't been renovated for a while. The room was a comfortable size with a small balcony looking onto the street, a king bed, TV and stereo sound system, wicker love seat. Also, a mini refrigerator, coffee maker, and a couple of bottles of complimentary water. Everything was clean and adequate, though a bit worn and outdated. There was a slight musty smell, probably a holdover from when smoking was allowed, but it didn't bother us. The jacuzzi bathtub in the bathroom (every room has one) was very nice. They give you a good collection of toiletries -- shampoo and conditioner, lotion, mineral bath, a couple of kinds of soap, etc. There is a hairdryer. The place was quiet, no problems with noise even on a Saturday night. Breakfast was offered in the lobby from 7 to 9 am (coffee, juice, fruit, various breads, butter, jam, cream cheese). I wouldn't recommend this place to someone on their honeymoon or a special trip, but definitely to someone looking for good basic accommodations in Waikiki at a reasonable price. We have stayed in a cheaper, rock-bottom price hotel for around $100 a night and regretted the choice (Pagoda Terrace -- downright dirty and scary). Waikiki Joy cost just a little bit more and was much nicer.
Reviews.Author: rivera71

Reviews.Content: Good Location Really did enjoy staying at this place. The rooms were quite small but didnt bother us that much. Loved the music system in the rooms. The view we had was lovely and would definitely stay at this place again. Only negative was checking out, the woman who served us was not that nice.
Reviews.Author: hugbear

Reviews.Content: Be ready !!!! If going to bed after 4AM is what you want during your vacation, you are at the right place. The noisy bars and night clubs of the street are closing at this time !Jason at the front desk was very friendly.The hotel have some good things, like the jacuzzi in the room, the space in the suite, nice kitchen, unfortunately, you just remember the bad one : - the nights not able to sleep - the useless general managerFor the same price, the suite with kitchen at the ocean resort are much better and you can sleep !It's not that we are not use to waikiki, it was our 6th trip to waikiki !If you want to stay at this hotel, good luck .But for sure, enjoy your stay in waikiki.Patrick
Reviews.Author: patrickEmeryville

Reviews.Content: Clean and large! Arrived at midnight and drove past the hotel. One way streets everywhere but I found it on the 2nd drive by. Check in was fast and pleasant. The front desk clerk parked my car and the security guard helped with my luggage.The room was large, I loved the jacuzzi and my Aunt enjoyed sitting on the lanai.The first night, I stayed in room 710 next to the elevator. It made horrible noises all night so I requested a room change the next day. Construction next door to the hotel brought the usual noises in the morning but nothing compared to the elevator.Yes, the elevator is small but we never left anyone behind. I loved the bathroom toiletries... large bottles of gels, lotions, shampoos etc.We enjoyed Moose McGillicudy's fantastic breakfasts, even a $1.99 special served before 0830. The waitstaff is so friendly and funny.
Reviews.Author: 1Panda

Reviews.Content: loved the Joy After some of the reviews I was kinda scared but we chose this hotel because of the area is close to everything and the price was great. We stayed for 2 weeks and loved it. The check-in was fast and we even had to change rooms and they were very fast and moved the luggage for us just as fast. Mark and Ryan were awesome with the valet and all the other stuff they do at the hotel. We got to know them well since they only have valet parking and they gave us great tips on resturants and directions.The hotel room is outdated but I was out of my room by 7am and usually not back till late..and the jacuzzi tub was awesome after a full day at the beach or the walking we did.The DFS Galleria shopping center is across the street and the bus to the Alo Moana Center is also there. They let you take the boogie boards and chairs if available to the beach they said no charge just bring them back. That was great since friends had to pay 8.00 to rent a board for the day.Im really happy we chose this hotel. I felt really safe were its located plus the cops like to eat breakfast at Moose's next door.The elevators maybe smaller than normal but we never had anyone in there when we used it. We had a great experience there and would highly recommend the hotel to others. Its not the Ritz but it is comfortable and clean and safe. I hope this helps...
Reviews.Author: mapa90

Reviews.Content: Had a great time My husband and I stayed for two days pre-cruise right before the July 4th holiday. I understand the hotel (and everywhere else) was pretty much sold out. We made reservations thru an internet website that does comparitive shopping among all sites. We got a price of a little over $100.00 a night. I had to laugh that some young girls sharing our shuttle asked the driver if there was any kind of convenience store near their hotel. They obviously didn't know about the legendary ABC stores on every street.We arrived at 10:30 PM (1:30AM our time). We were tired from our 6 hour flight from Phoenix and it was a pleasure that upon arrival our luggage was taken for us and check-in was very quick and easy. The staff at all times was very pleasant. The lobby and surrounding area is very pretty. Our luggage arrived at our room within minutes. We had a room on the 6th floor. The elevator, as some have commented is small, but it was no big deal. The room was very large. We had no view down as there was a parking lot and a side street with dumpsters. I simply chose to look toward the water and outward which was at the end of our lanai. The beds were two doubles. I requested a king, but they were up front about that not being a guarantee. I agree the room's furnishings could be considered dated including the stereo with cassette, but everything in our room was very clean. The bathrooms have large jacuzzi tubs and that made for a very relaxing evening soak after lots of walking. Breakfast the next morning consisted of the basic continental breakfast fare everyone has already mentioned. It was a great start to the day or there is a restaurant directly outside (Moose McGillicudys's) that had a breakfast special for a good price with eggs, bacon etc. As all have said the pool is only for getting wet. You won't be doing laps.My husband and I walked down Kalakaua Ave. half a block away, and a couple streets further to the ocean. One thing I became very aware of is the construction going on near Ft. Debussy Park. The city is making another pedestrian area for walking and the construction starts pretty early. I was really thankful we weren't staying close to that area. Kalakaua Ave. has both designer/boutique stores and the discount great for tourist stuff stores. There are nice restaurants and fast food places. Another advantage of the location of the Waikiki Joy is it's proximity to the bus stop. We did not rent a car and took the bus all over. You can check the website THEBUS[--] and bus schedules are available at the ABC stores for $3.00. The bus stop is half a block away approximately the other direction. Always ask for a transfer. Many times it saved us return fare. I believe you can get a multi day pass as well. I am one of those go with the flow types. It would take a lot to make me feel as though something had diminished my vacation. I would stay at the Waikiki Joy again, even if only for the tub!!
Reviews.Author: pal5510

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay A friend  I recently spent8 days in Waikiki. We had specific desires regarding our hotel  car rental so we worked through a local travel agent.We stayed @ Resort Quest Waikiki Joy in downtown Waikiki  were extremely happy with our choice. The room was clean, quiet, comfortable,  had several amenities (ie garden tub with spa )that we had not requested; though they were thouroughly enjoyed!The staff were pleasant, courteous, infortmed,  generous with assisteance:Directions, maps, bus routes, open/close time of attractions...I had a different flight out than my friend  staff arranged a late check time @ no cost, which was greatly appreciated!The hotel did have a restaurant  room service; however, we were within walking distance of approx 50 - 60 eating establishments, some fast food  some not.Shopping was the same; none in the hotel; 100's of shops within walking distance. We hope to return to HI  we will definately request the same accomadations!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel We had a great stay. We went through a travel agent and got a hotel/car deal for the 8 days we were there. People at the front desk, Valet parking and housekeeping staff made our stay wonderful! Mark, was awesome. He helped us with directions, recommendations, We even rode the bus one day and did not get lost.If you are looking for a resort with all the bells and whistles then you will be disappointed. But we were not their to swim in the pool, we had an ocean to play in! I would highly recommend this hotel. Easy to get too, good location, 3 blocks from the beach and easy access to other places.We had a superior room, 2 double bed and plenty of room to move around in.
Reviews.Author: LibTech

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel--if the year is 1982 This hotel was part of a honeymoon package that was purchased for us. We arrived and were almost immediately disappointed. The elevator leading up to our room was the size of a shoebox and had a funny smell. Our room was straight out of 1982--it even came with a high-fi tape deck. The bathroom was disgusting...rust and grime covered the fixtures and I only stepped into the bathtub after putting on flip-flops. We stayed 2 nights and then moved over to the JW Marriott--now there's a nice hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great price! We just got back from a 2 night stay at the Joy. They upgraded us to the penthouse floor, so we got a larger room on their tip floor! The service is excellent, especially Jason up at the front desk--very helpful and gave us some great advice for rainy day acticities. The location is also great--between the 2 main streets, close to the beach, shopping and dining!The room itself was spacious, king bed was standard, large lanai (city views only), bathroom had a nice jacuzzi tub, fitness facility was ok, but you had to pay for it...only minus was the breakfast--not much of a selection, just the basics of bread, bagels, muffins, pineapples, coffee and juice; nothing fancy but ok for the price. Paid a great rate of $109 off of their website! Would definately stay here again!
Reviews.Author: calisummer

Reviews.Content: Home away from Home I would have to say that the Waikiki Joy was much better than I ever could have imagined. Our room was very spacious and had a great balcony looking over the street. Sure it is a little dated, but with the facilities and location it offers and the comfy beds, we couldn't complain. The location is wonderful and you can catch a trolly pretty much accross the road. The main plus for my sister and I was that we felt safe there, you are close to the beach and the markets etc, but the hotel is located in a well lit quiet street. The breakfast was pretty good and a bonus was being able to take it back up to our room and have it there. The pool is really small, however you are close to Waikiki Beach so we didn't really use it much. Having a kitchen was great, we used it a lot more than anticipated, its equiped with a huge fridge, toaster cooking facilities etc and there are a few good grocery stores near by. All in all, we are in love with Hawaii and will be staying at the Joy again the next time we go back as we felt really at home. The only thing we found a bit strange is that you have to pay to use the in-house safe. It's only a couple of dollars per day, but worth a mention.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not a shopping centre pretending to be a Hotel as are others My husband, teenage daughter and myself stayed here for 5 nights. Yes the room is incredibly dated, but we found it to be clean. We had a suite which unfortunately overlooked a very noisy japanese restaurant and a sex parlour, so there was a lot of traffic...Our room smelt incredibly of smoke, even though we had requested a non-smoking. One comment, the pool is inside the outside dining area, so if you wish to swim and then rest on a lounge you have people sitting at tables beside you eating and drinking. They have free plug in internet which was a bonus. Breakfast is tea/coffee, juice, toast or bagels...also plates of fresh fruit. We enjoyed it every day....The staff were friendly and helpful. It isn't an Australian 4 or 5 star, but for the cost and the facilities we couldn't complain.The walk to the beach is only 2 blocks and isn't difficult at all, we did so every day. We walked through the Sheraton, Hilton etc. and I would rather have stayed where we did. It stood alone and wasn't a shopping centre masquarading as a hotel. Also it has a shop very close by for milk, bread etc. The room was extremely large and we also had cable TV. We enjoyed our stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location..just not the right place for business travelers.. Just returned from this hotel. This is certainly not the place to stay for anyone staying for business purposes. We stayed down the street last year and this is a much nicer, cleaner and friendlier hotel. The size of the room and lanai were acceptable and of course could use major updating. Second trip for us to Waikiki and this was the best buy and trip for us. Only had problems with the internet---must purchase a drink in restaurant in order to use...no printer hook up either. Breakfast was way too small compared to free breakfasts over on the mainland...but enough to last a few hours for a main meal. The majority of the front desk staff was very nice and helpful, a few mishaps, but all in all good trip.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Old and Tired with a Great location Located on a less populated end of Waikiki Beach the Aston definitely has a great view and location. The hotel decor however is not impressive. The lobby, pool, and resturant area were nicely decorated but elsewhere in the hotel the rooms and halls were old and dingy. The carpets were worn and dirty and the wall paper was peeling. Our no-smoking floor and room smelled of smoke because the other guests on the floor were smoking, a fact that the hotel management was aware of. The other disappointing thing was the the elevators. They were slow to arrive and unpredicable. They would skip floors or change direction. There was always a bottle-neck at the elevators.Next time we will pay alittle more and stay at a nicer hotel.
Reviews.Author: islandtripper

Reviews.Content: Well worth the money I just got back from spending a week at the Waikiki Joy. At first I was a little disappointed. It seemed kind of dated and a little worn. However, as the week went on, I truly felt like I made a good decision staying there. I would have easily spent twice as much if I was right on the beach, yet I was still able to dine at other hotel's beachfront restaurants. I didn't think I'd use the jacuzzi in the bathroom, but I ended up using it twice after taking some very long walks. The staff is very nice and while the continental breakfast got a little boring, it was nice to not have to pay for another meal. It only took me 5 minutes to walk to the beach although there is currently some construction going on down the block. Also, for anyone interested in singing, there are karaoke studios next door and I sang for over 5 hours straight for only $6.00.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice budget hotel! I'm giving this hotel a 'four' as a 'budget' hotel in Waikiki. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, the location was fantastic. While the decor and technology might be considered by other reviewers as 'outdated,' I suggest they pay $200-300 a night at the major chains. While the decor has a neat 70s/80s 'kitchy' feel to it, the rooms and property were clean and safe. I had a basic guest room with a jacuzzi tub, frig, and stereo system. The location is around the corner from major stores and restaurants, and the beach is a short 5-10 minute walk. While I didn't swim in their pool, it appeared clean and well-maintained. Several colleagues of mine stayed in other hotels in this price bracket, including other Aston hotels; I was the only one satisfied with my stay. The continental breakfast was simple and offered the typical 'continental' fare. My only criticism is the $5 fee to use the exercise room; however, I must applaud that the equipment in that room (a treadmill, bike, elliptical machine, and free weight system) were all brand new and in fully functioning condition -- the only hotel in my travels this summer which had such equipment. I also wish that wireless internet access was free and accessible in the rooms, rather than just in the lounge/restaurant. For those seeking a budget hotel in Waikiki, I can fully recommend the Waikiki Joy.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Waikiki Joy was a joy Not a top notch hotel, of course, but excellent quality for what you pay. If you're not too offended by 80s styling, this place has everything a budget traveller could ask for.We booked a club suite and were pleasantly surprised to get a near-full kitchen, including some pots and utensils to make food.Staff was extremely friendly (like everyone in Hawaii!) and were very accomodating when it came time to storing luggage and allowing for showers after check-out.Included breakfast is good, not great. If you don't mind a bagel every morning, you'll be fine.Good hotel, great location. 'nuf said.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Staff, but... Agreed with the last reviewer. Thought this would be business class hotel, but their idea of high speed internet was to go to the cafe and have to buy a drink in order to be hooked up. Lewers is not the nicest streets, and very hard to get to if you are not familiar with traffic. The staff was very nice, helpful, but the rooms are VERY old and dated. They try to keep the rooms clean by using too much spray in the rooms. This is one to come back to only for price and desperation...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Elegant ???? Elegant is not what I would us to describe this hotel. The room was dirty. The top covers stained. No housekeeper came one day. This hotel was not as advertised. The breakfast was poor. There have been some good write-ups about this place, but, it is hard to believe. I used those reviews to choose this hotel and was very disappointed......
Reviews.Author: RichardTacoma_WA

Reviews.Content: Spacious Junior suite My wife and I stayed at the 'Joy' in a junior suite for 9 nights in March / April 2005. The room was clean and very spacious and for an extended stay it was ideal. Occasionally during the night we could hear noise from the parking lot below and we were glad to be on the 7th floor and not on the 1st level. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in the hotel lobby each morning. This is the second time we have stayed here and would do so again if returning to Honolulu.
Reviews.Author: PPmember

Reviews.Content: A great value If you are willing to walk a couple of blocks to the beach, you can save a ton of $ by staying here. The rooms are nice, the hotel has a great indoor pool, a massage chair in the lobby, and an excellent breakfast which is included. The whirlpool tubs and lanais are a great touch. If you go to Hawaii, you should definitely see some other islands but for Oahu Waikiki Joy is a fantastic value in an otherwise expensive area.
Reviews.Author: cabdella

Reviews.Content: Good Value, Good Location, Noisy Street Side 2/21/05. This was the lowest priced Waikiki hotel I could find that was within walking distance to the beach and all the shopping. Very convenient location. The room was very clean. Basic king size bed, pillows were flat though, could use updating. I did get a non-smoking room with no problem though the room faced Lewers Street and it was noisy at times. Ask for a room not on Lewers Street. Good Value for the location. Don't expect excellent service and make sure you make your airport shuttle transportation well in advance, the front desk was hardly helpful in that area. Overall though it was worth the price.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not what we expected Aston Waikiki Joy Hotel. This hotel was advertised as having been recently upgraded. We did not find this was the case. Clean but definitely not recently refurbished. The staff were Ok but not helpful with tour bookings, did not seem to know too much at all. We never saw the same staff twice at the desk all week and we preferred to walk around to an Outrigger hotel to enquire about tours and make bookings. The only booking we made at the Joy was for our airport shuttle which did not turn up and we had to ring a Taxi. A bit disappointing allround. If staying in Waikiki for the first time, stay beachfront to take full advantage of the scenery. Aussie Traveller
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cute Hotel in the Middle of the Action My husband and I stayed 2 nights here on our first visit to Hawaii. We wanted an inexpensive nice place to stay before we went on to Kauai for the main part of our trip. The Waikiki Joy was great and I would definitely stay here again. The open air lobby was really neat. The location is fantastic if you don't necessarily want to stay near the beach. It is on a relatively quiet side street just one block from the main drag in Waikiki. I felt very safe walking around here at night. The ocean was about a 5 minute walk. Bus stops are nearby. The pool was tiny but clean and nice. The rooms were about average but very comfortable. The jacuzzi tub was a nice amenity. We really didn't use the Bose speakers. Breakfast was mainly fresh fruits, juices and coffee. I would recommend this place to anybody.
Reviews.Author: TruMom

Reviews.Content: Great bargain As others say, this is a smaller hotel in a great location at a great price. Yes, it's not the Sheraton or Marriott nearby, but you'll save a ton of money. Rooms are a decent size too, with a small fridge. Breakfast is less than wonderful, with only fruit, bagels, bread and the occasional danish. The staff is great and very helpful. The manager, Brian, is very friendly and eager to please. I'd definitely stay again.
Reviews.Author: mitchmurr

Reviews.Content: Nice room, great location Our room, a junior suite, was clean and comfortable. The location is excellent, under a block walk to several bus lines in one direction and less than a block walk to the main drag in Waikiki in the other direction. It was hotter than Hades while we were in Waikiki and we sweated everywhere else, but we cooled off in our room. No problems with the air conditioning, but it was a little difficult to figure out at first. We ordered a non-smoking king and that's what we got. The pool is really tiny, but was okay for soaking to cool off after roasting all day in Honolulu. Most of the guests were Japanese, so there were many smokers at breakfast (continental breakfast is included), but otherwise I have no complaints. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: coolcarm

Reviews.Content: Cheap, but you don't even get what you pay for. We prepaid for a nonsmoking, King-sized bed room. When we arrived we were told that we were being upgraded to a Jr. Suite.. so far so good. We got into the room and realized that is a smoking room and it had 2 double beds(not even queen sized), we said that we don't want to be upgraded. Well, they sold our room(even though it was prepaid) and smoking rooms was all they had left. The next night they moved us to another Jr. Suite(non smoking) but still 2 double beds. The A/C gave out halfway through the night. The next night we moved to another room(Jr. Suite double beds) A/C was better but never got below 72. In our entire stay we never got our King bed nonsmoking. The A/C is not powerful in any of the rooms we had. In addition the rooms don't have an ironing board! I can stay at a Motel 6 and get an ironing board. We had to have room service bring it up everytime we needed it. All in all....Pay a little more and at least stay in a name brand hotel with standard amenties.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel...consistent service and awesome location I have stayed at the Waikiki Joy more than 60 nights since Memorial Day of 2003. The staff never changes...always polite...always helpful whether with special requests or genuine interest in what the plans were for the day. The hotel is a slight bit worn but they are upgrading continuously. The suites are always clean and comfortable. Housekeeping is always immaculate. The Joy is a real value for this price range. Will return again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Pleasant Stay The Waikiki Joy was nice, but nothing above average. The staff was pleasant to deal with and it was nice having a continental breakfast which included various pastries, toast and fruit, along with Coffee and juices. The rooms were small but clean, and it was close to everything and surprisingly quiet even though it was close to the hustle and bustle. It was definitely worth the rate we paid, as we were not expecting anything extravegant. We spent most of our time at the beach anyway which was about a five minute walk. I recommend this hotel for the price and convenience of everything being so close. Overall, it was a very relaxing atmosphere.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay After lots of research, including reading reviews on here, we stayed at the Joy for 4 nights starting on 7/13. We were greated by a great open air lobby and nice staff.The room was larger than anticipated with two double beds and the four of us fit fine. The view was bad, but that's not what we were there for.It's about 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach and walkable to so many restaurants and parts of the beach.We were a block from Kuhio Avenue and a stop for The Bus to take you anywhere from Pearl Harbor to Diamondhead.The breakfast was brief, but a great way to start the day.The price was extremely reasonable and I would recommend the Joy to anyone wanting a hotel close to everything, but perhaps not if you plan on spending all your time at the hotel. I'd definately stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very EnJOYable Stayed at the Joy for 5 nights, part of an Expedia package deal. My wife and I have tried the 1000 room hotels and we just prefer the smaller hotels. Our room was next to the elevator on the 5th floor. Never heard the elevator. On Tuesday (Fat Tuesday), the street was closed for a block party. After making our way through the crowd to the hotel, couldn't hear a thing in the room, unless the balcony doors were open. VERY attentive staff. Location of the hotel is perfect, just 1 block off the main street, then another 2 blocks to the beach. Great continental breakfast to get the day going. Don't pass up the massage chair in the lobby ($1500 at Sharper Image). On the day we were leaving, check out time was 12 Noon, but our bus to the Airport wasn't until 8PM for an 11pm flight. The hotel has a hospitality suite (available for 1 hour time periods, at no charge) for freshening up. We used it from 7pm-8pm and were all set for our flight back to the Mainland. We will definitely stay here on our next trip back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Decent place, good price.   showReview(1709904, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, great location!   showReview(1534610, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - Wonderful Staff!   showReview(1442412, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Joy Hotel   showReview(1385597, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Good value for a short visit to Honolulu   showReview(1371464, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Joy is great little hotel!   showReview(1344950, 'full');

Reviews.Content: It was a "Joy" to stay here   showReview(1262692, 'full');
